About Me

Hi, I'm Tony! I am a frontend developer with a passion for learning, creating, and experimenting. I love the freedom of learning that programming offers, as well as the amazing power to bring ideas to life through code. I am currently learning learning ThreeJS on the side, and look forward to creating awesome animations and visual effects.


Outside of work, I thouroughly enjoy exploring my creative side through drone photography, playing the piano, and performing card magic. I also love playing with A.I. text models like GPT-3 to push the limits and find their capabilities.

My Projects

Autohotkey Script collection

Source + Demos

Autohotkey is what first got me hooked on coding in 2019. It allows for the creation of custom scripts to automate tasks and improve their workflow on Windows computers. I have compiled and wrote a large collection of scripts that have helped me automate my programming and regular workflows. This project is ongoing as I continually add new functionality and optimize my existing code. Take a look and see what you can do with Autohotkey!

Cool features

  • - Insta Google
  • - rem/px conversion
  • - A.I. analyzer

Technologies used: Autohotkey, OpenAI API

Portfolio Landing Page

Live site Source

If you can't tell, this websites sole purpose is to look cool and be a bit over the top. It's essentially a colorful 3D drawing board that you can control with your mouse. I built this portfolio landing page as an introduction to new topics for me like Three.js and Vue.js. While, originally created by Chris Lis, I added some of my own twists on solutions and made improvements. I'm most proud of a feature I implemented called Rainbow Mode.

Cool features

  • - Rainbow mode
  • - Skip to content for accessibility
  • - Orbit controls with mouse

Technologies used: HTML/CSS/JS, Nuxt.js, Vite, Three.js, Tailwind

Space Tourism

Live site Source

This is a space tourism website that with great info and amazing pictures of the planets, the crew, and the technology in space. I built this website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and utilized CSS custom properties and utility classes to create a maintainable and reusable codebase. I also took this opportunity to study best practices for accessibility and to gain insights into project planning and implementation using a Figma design file.

Cool features

  • - Multiple background images for different screen sizes
  • - Keyboard accessibility
  • - Animated button
  • - Fun space facts

Technologies used: HTML/CSS/JS, Github Pages

What to Say

Live site Source

This is a personal language learning handbook with the purpose of helping new language learners track phrases and their responses, as well as take notes on them. I focused mainly focused on the back end at first and used Ruby with the Sinatra framework. I implemented many features that we users take for granted with minimal dependencies. Some of these include URL validation, pagination, and flash messaging.

Cool features

  • - Persists data through PSQL database
  • - Multiple simultaneous validations of Entry inputs
  • -

Technologies used: Ruby, Sinatra, PSQL, Heroku, HTML/CSS
